content: Welcome to anyone that is testing out Zulip.
Replying in the general > Welcome topic.
Welcome. It's good to have company here.
I like how you can pull out a single conversation to view.
Yes, I think that Topics are a stand out feature for Zulip.
New emojis!
Hmm, the UI seems quite busy.
Yeah, takes some getting used to...
I have just joined.

Yeah, takes some getting used to...

Indeed, but could be worth it!
(Using the browser.) I'm confused about the blue outline on messages: What does it mean? And it seems to move when I scroll, but it's more jumping, hard to control.

The blue outline seems to indicate the "active" message, maybe. If you click on a message, it gets the blue outline.

But, it's not clear how this is determined while scrolling through messages. It does jump around in unexpected ways.
Hi folks
In Zulip looks like there are topics which are still in general flow and streams which are completely separate
I believe the blue outline is what you'll be replying to should you type a message. Guessing it follows the highlighted topic as you scroll through a stream.

Streams are like rooms and determine who sees a message (people subscribed to that stream). Topics are a way of categorising messages within a stream (so everyone subscribed to the stream sees them), and this is where Zulip is better than Gitter (easier to catch up on relevant conversations/topics within a stream).
Hello :wave:
...I like how there's a setting for "alert words" and "muted topics" :+1:
Yeah that's nice
...now to see if Zulip works with my all-in-one chat app (https://getstation.com)
...it does!! :slight_smile:
@Peter Anderson (BWPanda) we'll probably need a stream for security discussions. I think they can be set to invite only. Everything else might work in #General with topics
I just created a topic for contrib :wink:
:shrug:
Maybe this can be it's own topic as well. :smirk: Maybe lando?
True that. Doing...
Wondering if messages can be assigned topics retroactively
Yup they can ...I just edited my previous messages, and have moved them into a "Lando" topic :wink:
I'm sure there will be a messy period when we figure out where things go. Looks like "replies" don't "move" when the original is assigned a different topic
Oh wait... I can manually change it tho
...yup, you CAN "move" them.
...just edit your comment, and manually edit the topic to the "target" one :slight_smile:
We just can't reassign someone else's message
I think
Seems that I can
It's the "View source/Edit topic" option :wink:
Oh? Maybe you're an admin?
:shrug:
Screen-Shot-2020-01-05-at-8.52.06-pm.png
Hmm, can't find that option on the mobile app
Oh, I'm using the web app. Let me give the phone app (Android) a go ...
Yup, not available on the mobile app :confused:
...not a biggie. When there's enough of us in Zulip, we could be crowdsourcing the task of moving comments to appropriate streams/topics :wink:
...as in, I'm sure that there'll be many others using the web app.
I'll be using both.
There you have it :slight_smile:

In my opinion, a topic name like "Lando" is too generic here. In this regard, I found the recommendation from https://zulipchat.com/help/about-streams-and-topics interesting: "If you ever find yourself stuck on writing a topic, just pretend you're sending an email, with the topic as the subject line."
You're probably right @Olaf Grabienski
Maybe we need a stream like #debugging
Debugging what?
Debugging anything? A stream can be more generic
Welcome @indigoxela !
(was just looking through app options and saw online users :blush:)

(was just looking through app options and saw online users :blush:)

Yes, I'm just too curious, I know... :rofl:
Morning, just testing
:wave:
I thought you were using a different AIO chat app. Did you switch?
I tried replying to a previous message from @Gregory Netsas there while it was selected/highlighted in blue, wondering if they would be connected, but they weren't.

It's my understanding that replies are always in chronological order. I believe, that if you reply to another message that means that your reply will have the same topic, but it will still appear as the most recent post in the stream and in the topic.

Zulip seems to give the impression that it allows threads. But, in fact, it's really a single stream of posts in chronological order - but, with the ability to filter by stream or topic. When you reply to a post, you have ability to control which stream and topic your post belongs to. But, I think, your post will always appear as the most recent post in either the respective stream and/or topic.

I concur with @StPaulTim (from what I've seen and understand of Zulip). Think of replying to someone in Zulip like replying to them in Gitter. Your reply will still appear at the end of the list and will not really have any connection to the post you're replying to (other than maybe the @username tag), but Zulip has the added ability to hide all other posts in the channel not related to that topic, so makes it a bit easier to follow a related conversation.
Wow, great to see so many people joining here! That's really encouraging :smile:

Thanks for the confirmation, @StPaulTim and @Peter Anderson (BWPanda). I was curious (based on some previous comments) if writing a response while a message had a blue border on it would affect the response in any way.
Only in so much as it's assigned the same topic.
@Jason Flatt - I think the only relevance of the blue border is that it determines the default stream and topic of your reply.
@StPaulTim I see what you mean now.

@Jason Flatt I was originally using https://meetfranz.com, which basically does the same job, but they've at some point switched to a paid scheme, and have required registration after 5.0. That made me search for alternatives, and that's when some colleagues of mine mentioned https://getstation.com, which is open-source. I've switched, and been happy with it since.
@Gregory Netsas Can you post a screenshot of the GetStation interface for Zulip? Be interested to see how it compares to the Zulip desktop app...
Also, still getting used to having to write @Gregory Netsas instead of @klonos... :wink:
There you go ...I've changed my profile name to "klonos" :slight_smile:
...and sure re the screenie of Station, but it basically is just a wrapper for web apps and/or APIs exposed by various chatting services, so should be the same as the web app for Zulip.
Screen-Shot-2020-01-06-at-7.12.05-am.png
...here it is ^^
(I'm using the "dark mode" option in their web app)
Ah ok, cool. Yes, very similar.

Do we have a generic way to programmatically detect if the current site is an existing site vs fresh installation. ...I am aware of $config->isNew(), but that implies checking a specific configuration; whereas I want to limit an update hook to run only on exiting sites.
@klonos At what point does a fresh site become existing...?
Any configuration changed after the "welcome/congrats" message (right after the installation finishes) and/or of any new content/users have been added.
...would need to take into consideration that certain installation profiles may not be adding content.
I thought that we'd have some sort of "flag" for this.
Hmm, not that I know of...
@klonos Ah, yes, Franz. I tried it for a day, but didn't care for their UI, so I removed it and want back to separate apps.

@Jason Flatt ...as you can see from the screenshot I've posted earlier, I have 7-some chat channels/apps. I imagine that people that are on Facebook, Tweeter and the likes may have even more. Keeping track of all the respective apps and/or browser tabs may become an issue, and that's the use case that Franz, Station, and apps of their like try to solve. ...I understand that this may not be an issue with some people that choose to have less social channels.
...for me, having a single app for all my chat/social makes it easier (I have a dedicated monitor for that app on the left of my work and home desk, arranged vertically).

GitHub issues can now be linked more easily:
#2655 produces #2655
backdrop-ops/contrib#344 produces backdrop-ops/contrib#344

It seems that we can't easily link to repos with a . in the name (e.g. github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org) as it's not a supported character in the regex where this is setup. I've emailed Zulip support about this.

To clarify, you can type a hash (#) followed by a number and it'll automatically link to that issue in the main Backdrop issue queue. To link to a different issue queue, use the syntax: org/repo#number where org is the GitHub organisation (e.g. 'backdrop', 'backdrop-ops', 'backdrop-contrib'), repo is the repository name and number is the issue number to link to.

Linking to Pull Requests works similarly: #pr[number] (e.g. #pr123)
And: [org]/[repo]#pr[number] (e.g. backdrop-ops/contrib#pr352)

I've also just enabled link previews: #2655

Fix ordering issues in admin menu · Issue #2655 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
In #2502 @olafgrabienski pointed out that the content type ordering is inconsistent in the admin bar: Looks good at first view. Then I've seen another place where the content types don't so...

backdrop-contrib/drush#7

Add support for drush en (enable) and drush dis (disable) · Issue #7 · backdrop-contrib/drush
Allow Backdrop CMS users to enable and/or disable modules from the command line. drush en {module_name} drush dis {module_name} PR #40 PR: #51 PR: #52 PR: #80 PR: #98
Hello! Just trying out Zulip. Took me a minute both to find where to post and how to do it, but I got here! :smiley: :shrug:

Hi, Nate Lampton. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.
@Nate Lampton - the welcome message is a custom touch of my own. Basically, the bot is tracking everyone that logs into Zulip and if someone posts for the first time, it gives them a welcome message.
Would could also automate additional messages after they have been a member for a while.
Hello, updating this topic just to see how Zulip deals with it.

Here's an idea @StPaulTim: how about a short intro video on how the threads work on Zulip? ...we can link to that video from the welcome message, saying something like "Watch this short 3min video, to see how this chat works"
...perhaps such a video already exists.
I was literally thinking of something like that yesterday. One of us recording a screen cast showing how Zulip works...
There may be a generic video, but I would be willing to make a short Backdrop video (possibly tonight). Good idea. @klonos
Good idea @BWPanda (Peter)
YouTube - Welcome to Backdrop CMS community on Zulip
Let's pretend this is my first visit.

Hi, Tim (test) Erickson. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
Nice video! @StPaulTim
Thanks. Any suggestions for improvement?
I'm not sure if this helps, but how about a second video on how to sign up for a Zulip account?

I thought about that. We'll see. Most people will not see this video until after they register and arrive. So, it's too late. But, there could be another for people who have not got this far. It's tricky, because I have to cancel my account to re-register.
And if I need multiple takes.
Yup. Or create a new GitHub account too
And you'd have to post the video elsewhere, such as on b.org
Yup, it'd need to go to https://backdropcms.org/support/resources

I kinda did something like that: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/587#issuecomment-582084322

Discussion: Alternatives to Gitter · Issue #587 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
I am opening this issue, because the discussion of moving off of Gitter keeps coming up from time to time and we don't currently have a good issue to capture the thoughts and history of this di...
...and once (if?) we make an official switch to Zulip, we can do a blog post/announcement about that, and the link to that video can go into that blog post.

@StPaulTim You said at the beginning of the video that messages are sorted chronologically with oldest at bottom and newest at top... I think you then said the opposite later in the video (newest at bottom).
Might also be worth showing how to post a new message (and create topic) and maybe how one would approach going through new messages to catch up after being away or just joining).
@BWPanda (Peter) - I'll check later.
...you also mentioned "this is confusing" a few times; perhaps better say "this may be confusing to some".
Dragonbot Welcome

Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

If you are new to our Zulip channel and just "hanging out" and observing. That's great, we're glad you are here. But, please feel free to say "hi" and let us know if you have any questions. We love to hear from new folks.
@indigoxela ++ (for all the contributions)
indigoxela leveled up! (Karma: 1)

Putting this video that the bot showed me in this 'stream':
Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. YouTube - Welcome to Backdrop CMS community on Zulip
Hey @wesruv - Welcome.

Greetings everybody. I've been so busy that I haven't monitored backdropcms chat in a while. I Just discovered the move to zulip the other day. I just told it to create a new zulip account using my github credentials like I did under gitter. I hope that was the recommended way. I didn't see anything indicating there was a way to transfer my gitter account along with posting history over. So far, it seems like a pretty nice chat interface.

Hi, Vincent Stemen. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
@Dragonbot help

!<factoid> - play back a factoid
<thing>++ - give thing some karma
[item]++ or [user]++ | Adds karma
dragonbot adapter - Reply with the adapter
dragonbot add issue [IssuePath] - Add an issue to our 'needs attention' list
dragonbot add issue [IssuePath] - Add an issue to our 'needs attention' list
dragonbot alias <factoid> = <factoid>
dragonbot attention - How to add an issue to 'needs attention' list
dragonbot attention - How to add an issue to 'needs attention' list
dragonbot delete reminder <action> - Delete reminder matching <action> (exact match required)
dragonbot drop <factoid> - permanently forget a factoid
dragonbot echo <text> - Reply back with <text>
dragonbot factoids - get a link to the raw factoid data
dragonbot forget <factoid> - forget a factoid
dragonbot help - Displays all of the help commands that this bot knows about.
dragonbot help <query> - Displays all help commands that match <query>.
dragonbot karma <thing> - check thing's karma (if <thing> is omitted, show the top 5)
dragonbot karma best [n] - show the top n (default: 5)
dragonbot karma best [n] - top [n]
dragonbot karma empty <thing> - empty a thing's karma
dragonbot karma worst [n] - bottom [n]
dragonbot karma worst [n] - show the bottom n (default: 5)
dragonbot learn <factoid> = <details> - learn a new factoid
dragonbot learn <factoid> =~ s/expression/replace/gi - edit a factoid
dragonbot list all factoids - list all factoids
dragonbot map me <query> - Returns a map view of the area returned by query.
dragonbot ping - Reply with pong
dragonbot pug bomb N - get N pugs
dragonbot pug me - Receive a pug
dragonbot remember <factoid> - remember a factoid
dragonbot remind me (on <date>|in <time>) to/that <action> - Set a reminder in <time> to do an <action> <time> is in the format 1 day, 2 hours, 5 minutes etc. Time segments are optional, as are commas
dragonbot remind show - Shows a list of current reminders ('show reminders' will also work)
dragonbot remove issue - Remove your 'needs attetion' issue
dragonbot remove issue - Remove your 'needs attetion' issue
dragonbot schedule [add|new] "<cron pattern>(,<utc offset>)" <message> - Schedule a message that runs recurrently.
dragonbot schedule [add|new] "<datetime pattern>" <message> - Schedule a message that runs on a specific date and time
dragonbot schedule [add|new] #<room> "<cron pattern>(,<utc offset>)" <message> - Schedule a message to a specific room that runs recurrently
dragonbot schedule [add|new] #<room> "<datetime pattern>" <message> - Schedule a message to a specific room that runs on a specific date and time
dragonbot schedule [cancel|del|delete|remove] <id> - Cancel the schedule
dragonbot schedule [upd|update] <id> <message> - Update scheduled message
dragonbot schedule env - Show hubot schedule environments
dragonbot schedule list #<room> - List all scheduled messages for specified room
dragonbot schedule list - List all scheduled messages for current room
dragonbot schedule list all - List all scheduled messages for any rooms
dragonbot search <substring> - list factoids which match (by factoid key or result)
dragonbot show needs attention - Show a list of issues that need your attention
dragonbot show needs attention - Show a list of issues that need your attention
dragonbot the rules - Make sure hubot still knows the rules.
dragonbot time - Reply with current time
dragonbot translate me <phrase> - Searches for a translation for the <phrase> and then prints that bad boy out.
dragonbot translate me from <source> into <target> <phrase> - Translates <phrase> from <source> into <target>. Both <source> and <target> are optional
dragonbot welcome - Shows welcome message
dragonbot welcome - Shows welcome message

Welcome to the new Backdrop chat in Zulip @Vincent Stemen :wave: ...Gitter history has not been migrated over here, so no worries about that ...and yes, people with GItHub accounts have the option to use their GitHub accounts to log into Zulip ...not a requirement though; everyone is free to use their personal email for example :wink:
...please let us know if you need help navigating/orientating :slight_smile:
Sounds good. Thanks.
